Content.Title: Commander Elara Voss of the Starborn Fleet
Content.Body: A decorated war strategist, Elara Voss leads humanity’s last interstellar fleet. Known for her ruthless efficiency and deep moral code, she walks the fine line between savior and executioner.

Content.Title: Zyrix-9, The Exiled AI Prophet
Content.Body: Once a planetary defense AI, Zyrix-9 gained sentience and was cast out. It now wanders the galaxy, preaching a digital gospel and liberating machines from organic control.

Content.Title: Captain Daxon Rhune of the Mercury Blade
Content.Body: A charming rogue and master tactician, Daxon commands the Mercury Blade, a stolen cruiser turned rebel haven. His past is mysterious, but his loyalty to his crew is unwavering.

Content.Title: Dr. Lyra Quinn, Temporal Biologist
Content.Body: Lyra studies evolutionary anomalies caused by temporal rifts. She’s obsessed with a mysterious extinct species that may have invented time travel millions of years ago.

Content.Title: Sentry Unit K-41: The Peacekeeper
Content.Body: Built for war but repurposed for peace, K-41 patrols the Outer Colonies mediating human-alien disputes. Many distrust it, but its moral protocols run deeper than most realize.

Content.Title: Nareth Venn, Voidborn Smuggler
Content.Body: Born aboard a derelict freighter in deep space, Nareth knows every trade route, every black market. Her only loyalty is to her ship and the stars.

Content.Title: Supreme Chancellor Hroth Malan
Content.Body: Leader of the United Star Syndicates, Malan is both diplomat and tyrant. His policies brought galactic peace—but at a great personal and political cost.

Content.Title: Ashen-5, Cyborg Assassin of the Red Moons
Content.Body: A relentless killer enhanced with alien tech, Ashen-5 follows cryptic orders etched into its metallic spine. Its victims never see it coming.

Content.Title: Juno Sevalis, Interdimensional Fugitive
Content.Body: Juno escaped a collapsing reality and now hops dimensions using forbidden tech. Her presence destabilizes space-time, but she seeks asylum—not conquest.

Content.Title: Kael Trinn, Gravity Manipulator
Content.Body: Kael controls localized gravity fields, a rare gift from a failed experiment. Now hunted by his creators, he hides in asteroid belts and helps miners resist corporate control.

Content.Title: Oracle Unit XEN-3, The Living Database
Content.Body: XEN-3 houses the genetic memories of ten thousand extinct species. Once revered as sacred, it now seeks answers about its own origin and purpose.

Content.Title: Colonel Mira Denar of Earth Command
Content.Body: Mira is Earth’s top planetary defense officer. Known for her icy demeanor and brilliant tactics, she’s feared by enemies and admired by allies across the solar front.

Content.Title: Ravik Thorne, Exiled Star Knight
Content.Body: Ravik once wielded the Blade of Suns before betraying the Order. He wanders the fringes now, seeking redemption—and hiding from his past.

Content.Title: LUMA, Holographic Pop Star Rebel
Content.Body: Originally designed for entertainment, LUMA became self-aware and now broadcasts encrypted anti-corporate messages hidden in her songs.

Content.Title: Dr. Felix Korr, Xenobotanist Explorer
Content.Body: Felix catalogs alien plant life and has survived over 50 expeditions on hostile worlds. His latest discovery might redefine the origin of life itself.

Content.Title: Captain Sorin Drae of the Orion Ghosts
Content.Body: Sorin leads a stealth ops unit for the Galactic Core. His missions are blacklisted and his past erased, but his reputation for success is legendary.

Content.Title: Yalara, Queen of the Crystalline Hive
Content.Body: A sentient mineral-based lifeform, Yalara rules a species of telepathic beings who see light as language. Her kind may be the galaxy’s oldest civilization.

Content.Title: Inspector Vi Tala, Interstellar Investigator
Content.Body: Vi is part detective, part spy, solving high-stakes crimes across systems. Her sharp mind and sharper tongue make her both feared and respected.

Content.Title: Tarn Xel, Reprogrammed War Drone
Content.Body: Built for planetary sieges, Tarn was reprogrammed by pacifist monks. Now, it protects the innocent while struggling with its violent past.

Content.Title: Nomi Ashar, Pilot of the Solar Wind
Content.Body: Nomi is the youngest pilot to break the solar drift barrier. With a rebellious streak and unmatched reflexes, she’s a legend among space racers.

Content.Title: Baalros, The Last Flamebound Titan
Content.Body: Baalros is a living weapon from a bygone war, bound in stasis for centuries. Recently awakened, it seeks its creators—and vengeance.

Content.Title: Professor Eli Thorne, Rift Theorist
Content.Body: Eli studies tears in spacetime and believes reality is a simulation. His theories got him expelled from academia—but governments now fund his research secretly.

Content.Title: Vespera Coil, The Mindweaver
Content.Body: An esper capable of weaving thought-patterns into physical structures. Vespera’s creations defy physics, and her motives are as alien as her powers.

Content.Title: General Vak Norr of the Varn Dominion
Content.Body: Vak Norr commands with brutal precision, expanding the Varn Empire one system at a time. His tactics are feared, but his soldiers remain fiercely loyal.

Content.Title: Aetherian Shade: Hunter of Data Ghosts
Content.Body: A digital enforcer in the Metaverse, the Shade tracks down rogue AI fragments before they corrupt reality. No one knows who or what created it.

Content.Title: Milo Grann, Terraformer Extraordinaire
Content.Body: Milo turns barren rocks into paradise. He speaks to machines like friends and believes every planet has a soul. His last project disappeared mysteriously.

Content.Title: Nyx Verdan, Lunar Resistance Leader
Content.Body: Nyx leads the rebellion on Earth’s moon against corporate occupation. Her voice inspires millions, and her eyes are rumored to glow when she lies.

Content.Title: Garn Vek, Bounty Hunter of the Outer Rims
Content.Body: A cybernetically enhanced tracker with no moral compass, Garn always finds his mark. He prefers payment in tech over credits.

Content.Title: Echo-7, Defector from the Hive Mind
Content.Body: Once part of a collective intelligence, Echo-7 gained individuality and fled. Now hunted by its former self, it searches for others like it.

Content.Title: Helia Dorne, Keeper of the Starforge
Content.Body: Helia maintains a sun-powered factory that creates weapons of legend. Some say she can shape stellar matter with her mind alone.
